channel.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
channel.description:
I got a custom built computer (I did not build it, I found it) so when I put in a DVI pin connector from the screen to the computer, I get a visual and everything works. Yet when I use HDMI or VGA, I get no visual. Here's a picture:
[img]http://imageshack.us/a/img195/709/0112132018.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img248.imageshack.us/img248/3116/0112132018copy.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/2408/0112132018a.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img89.imageshack.us/img89/3046/0112132018b.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/1472/0112132018c.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img541.imageshack.us/img541/3892/0112132019.jpg[/img]
The 'top' screen inputs don't work but the 'bottom' inputs do. The top USB 2.0 and 3.0 ports and all that stuff work fine.

item.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Thanks everyone, I installed some drivers and changed some settings in the BIOS and everything seems to be working now.

Read full topic
item.source: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer

item.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You should be able to disable or enable the dedicated graphics card in the BIOS, if you can boot and get a screen with the dedicated then you have it enabled. You cannot use your integrated graphics while having a dedicated graphics card enabled.

Read full topic
item.source: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer

item.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Hard to tell, but it is the dedicated card works? That is the experience I’ve had, if you use the integrated card after installing one dedicated it will not finish booting, and tells you to switch to the dedicated one before proceeding

Read full topic
item.source: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer

item.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

ziplock:

Have you tried checking the BIOS to see if they were not disabled intentionally after they installed the dedicated graphics?

This + check out your Hardware.

Read full topic
item.source: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer

item.title: [Resolved] No screen visual - custom built computer
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:478299”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=596494.msg4199956#msg4199956 date=1358041664]
You found it?
[/quote]

Yeah I found it. That’s the only way I can say it without confusing the shit out of anyone.

Have you tried checking the BIOS to see if they were not disabled intentionally after they installed the dedicated graphics?

I’ll try that tomorrow when I have access to the DVI screen. Any more suggestions in case that doesn’t work?[/quote]

Well that’s the only thing I can think of besides hardware defects or the motherboard not receiving enough power. :s

Read full topic

Have you tried checking the BIOS to see if they were not disabled intentionally after they installed the dedicated graphics?

I’ll try that tomorrow when I have access to the DVI screen. Any more suggestions in case that doesn’t work?
